summary: REQ-52 and most of REQ-53 appear implemented via a shared BuildVersionLabel (shown in the public footer and admin login) plus startup/back-end connectivity gating and a public error boundary. REQ-51 (deployment rollback + keeping broken build accessible separately without data loss) is not evidenced in the diff summary.

missing_requirements.requirement: Restore the last known working deployed version as the primary production version, and keep the currently-deployed (broken) version accessible separately for troubleshooting (without deleting/replacing the previous working deployment), ensuring no backend data loss.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff only shows frontend code changes (version label, health gate, error boundary, connectivity-aware UI/hooks). There is no evidence of deployment configuration/hosting changes, routing to serve two deployed versions (prod vs separate preview/versioned path), or any rollback mechanism that would switch production traffic back to a previous deployment while keeping the broken one accessible.
